title: Request for Proposals (RFP)
disclaimer: This is a notional RFP template prepared for internal planning and training. Replace bracketed items and verify clause selections with your contracting office.
markdown:
# Request for Proposals (RFP)

**AI Acquisition Automation Program**
**Solicitation No.:** \[TBD]
**Issue Date:** \[TBD]
**Response Due:** \[MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT]
**Point of Contact (POC):** \[Name], Contracting Officer, \[[email@domain.mil](mailto:email@domain.mil)]
**Secondary POC:** \[Name], Contract Specialist, \[[email@domain.mil](mailto:email@domain.mil)]

> **Disclaimer (Example Template):** This is a notional RFP template prepared for internal planning and training. Replace bracketed items and verify clause selections with your contracting office.

---

## Section A - Overview

The U.S. Air Force seeks proposals for an **AI-enabled acquisition automation prototype** that reduces cycle time and workload across the requirements-to-award pipeline. The prototype shall convert messy requirements into SMART requirements, automate RFI/RFP drafting and posting, scan the vendor market, collect proposals into **EZSource**, support **automated source selection evaluations** with **human-in-the-loop (HITL)** review, and generate an **SSA briefing deck** to justify award decisions.

The Government anticipates a **phased, competitive down-select** culminating in a single award. The Government will furnish SME access (ACE/EZSource) and entry-level **TEAMS training** for Government stakeholders.

---

## Section B - Supplies/Services and Prices

**Contract Type:** \[Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP) Base with Optional CLINs; include T\&M/FFP-LOE only if justified]

| CLIN       | Description                               | Deliverables (summary)                                                                   | POP         | Price     |
| ---------- | ----------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | --------- |
| 0001       | **Architecture \& Prototype Plan**         | System Architecture, Data Mgmt Plan, Security Plan, Test \& Evaluation Master Plan (TEMP) | Base Mo 1   | $_____ |
| 0002       | **SMART Requirements Engine (v1)**        | Requirement extraction/transformation service; metrics dashboard                         | Base Mo 2-3 | $_____ |
| 0003       | **RFI/RFP Drafting \& Posting Automation** | RFI/RFP builder, posting adapter for ad hoc FEDBIZ/SAM-style portal                      | Base Mo 2-4 | $_____ |
| 0004       | **Vendor Market Scan Service**            | Market scan pipelines, vendor ranking, auditable scoring                                 | Base Mo 3-4 | $_____ |
| 0005       | **Proposal Ingest to EZSource**           | Adapters/APIs, schema maps, error handling, audit logs                                   | Base Mo 3-5 | $_____ |
| 0006       | **Eval Engine \& SSA Deck Generator**      | Criteria config, rubric execution, EN drafting assist, SSA deck builder                  | Base Mo 4-6 | $_____ |
| 0007       | **Pilot \& Demo (F-47 corpus)**            | End-to-end pilot using provided email threads \& artifacts                                | Base Mo 6   | $_____ |
| 0008       | **Training \& Transition**                 | User guides, CBT/TEAMS modules, operator \& admin training                                | Base Mo 6   | $_____ |
| 0009 (OPT) | **Hardening \& Scale-out**                 | Perf/security hardening, IL\[4/5] deployment path                                        | OY1         | $_____ |
| 0010 (OPT) | **O\&M / Help Desk**                      | Patches, updates, SLAs                                                                   | OY1         | $_____ |
| 0011 (OPT) | **Data/Model Governance**                 | Model re-training, drift monitoring, SBOM updates                                        | OY1         | $_____ |

> **Note:** Offerors shall provide a detailed price breakout by labor category, hours, ODCs, cloud usage, and any third-party licenses per CLIN.

---

## Section C - Description/Specifications/Statement of Work (SOW)

### C.1 Background \& Purpose

The Air Force is launching a high-impact initiative to **revolutionize** how it builds requirements, posts RFIs/RFPs, evaluates proposals, and awards contracts. The solution will **automate around** core programs to reduce cycle time, confusion, and manual workload-**not** replace them.

### C.2 Concept of Operations (CONOPS) - In Scope

1. **SMART Requirement Analysis \& Refinement**
   - Ingest unstructured inputs (emails, notes) and produce **SMART** requirements with traceability to sources.
   - Provide confidence scores, explainability, and human accept/reject workflow.

2. **Automated RFI/RFP Drafting \& Posting**
   - Generate draft RFIs/RFPs from approved SMART requirements and acquisition strategy templates.
   - Post via adapter to an **ad hoc FEDBIZ-style site** (and/or SAM-compatible export), with version control and audit.

3. **Vendor Market Scanning**
   - Scan public data sources to identify qualified vendors, rank against requirements, and capture evidence trails.

4. **Proposal Collection \& Upload to EZSource**
   - Validate submissions, normalize metadata, and bulk upload to **EZSource** with error handling and audit logs.

5. **Automated Evaluation \& EN Drafting**
   - Execute configurable rubrics; draft **Evaluation Notices (ENs)**; support consensus documentation; maintain full provenance.

6. **SSA Briefing Deck Generation**
   - Auto-compile SSA deck materials to support best-value decisions and trade-off narratives (HITL approval required).

### C.3 Notional Operating Roles

- **Team 1 - Source Selection Team (Gov't):** Defines evaluation criteria, operates tools, approves outputs.
- **Contractor(s):** Build website/adapters, market scan automations, proposal ingest, eval engines, SSA deck generator.
- **ACE \& EZSource Teams (Gov't):** Provide SME support and TEAMS training to Government users.

### C.4 Government-Furnished Information (GFI) \& Attachments

- **Attachment J-1:** *F-47 Requirement Email Threads* (Initial Discussion; Downtime Reduction; SMART Refinement) - for ingestion, SMART transformation, and traceability demonstrations.
- **Attachment J-2:** *F-47 AI-Powered Log \& Supply ERP Threads* (Kickoff; Digging Deeper; Partial SMART; Fully SMART) - for additional scenario runs and benchmarking.
- **Attachment J-3:** EZSource API/adapter specifications \[TBD].
- **Attachment J-4:** Data classification guide and redaction rules \[TBD].

### C.5 Technical Requirements (Minimum)

- **R1 - SMART Engine Quality:** >= **0.85 F1** on test set for correct extraction of Specific/Measurable/Time-bound elements; >= **95%** source-trace coverage.
- **R2 - Posting Automation:** Generate RFI/RFP drafts that pass contracting officer checklist with <= 10% manual edits on average for pilot artifacts.
- **R3 - Market Scan:** Identify >= **90%** of known qualified vendors in a Government-curated truth set; provide explainable ranking features.
- **R4 - EZSource Ingest:** **100%** schema compliance; <= **0.5%** reject rate due to format errors in pilot.
- **R5 - Evaluation Engine:** Execute rubric scoring with **inter-rater reliability >= 0.8** vs. human panel baseline; produce draft ENs aligned to criteria.
- **R6 - SSA Deck:** Auto-compile a complete draft deck covering factors, ratings, risks, and trade-off rationale conforming to Gov template.
- **R7 - HITL Controls:** Every automation has human approval gates; all actions fully auditable (who/what/when/source).
- **R8 - Security \& Compliance:**
  - Data protection consistent with **RMF** (DoDI 8510.01) objectives and **NIST SP 800-53 Moderate** controls for pilot;
  - If cloud services are used, align to **FedRAMP Moderate** and **DoD Cloud SRG IL4/5 path** (as applicable);
  - **NIST SP 800-171/CMMC L2** for contractor systems handling CUI;
  - **SBOM** for deliverables; supply-chain risk management; zero-trust principles;
  - No training on non-public Government data without written consent; redact per J-4.
- **R9 - Accessibility \& Usability:** **Section 508** conformance; role-based access; audit logs; admin dashboards.
- **R10 - Interoperability:** Open APIs; export/import of artifacts (JSON/CSV/PDF/DOCX); containerized deployment option.

### C.6 Acceptance Criteria (Pilot)

Using Attachments J-1 and J-2:

1. **SMART Transformation Test:** Produce SMART requirements and a comparison report showing trace links back to specific emails. Pass if >=0.85 F1 and >=95% trace coverage (R1).
2. **End-to-End Run:** Given a sample messy requirement, generate an RFI and RFP draft, perform market scan (top-10 ranked list with evidence), simulate proposal ingest (mock files), run evaluation rubric, draft ENs, and produce an SSA deck. Pass if all artifacts meet R2-R6 thresholds and logs are complete.
3. **Security \& Audit:** Demonstrate role-based HITL approvals and immutable audit logs; pass RMF control checks for the pilot scope.

### C.7 Deliverables (Data Rights in Section H)

- D-1 Architecture \& Data Mgmt Plan; Security Plan; TEMP
- D-2 SMART Engine (container/image), config, and APIs
- D-3 RFI/RFP Generator + Posting Adapter
- D-4 Market Scan Pipelines + Evidence Store
- D-5 EZSource Ingest Adapters
- D-6 Evaluation Engine + EN Drafting Assist
- D-7 SSA Deck Generator + Gov Template
- D-8 Pilot Demo Report \& Metrics Pack
- D-9 Training Materials (CBT, TEAMS decks), Admin \& User Guides

---

## Section D - Packaging \& Marking

Electronic deliverables via secure repository (\[TBD]), with checksum and SBOM. Mark CUI per J-4.

---

## Section E - Inspection \& Acceptance

- Government COR reviews deliverables against Section C metrics within **10 business days**.
- Defects tracked to closure; re-test permitted within POP.

---

## Section F - Deliveries or Performance (Schedule)

**Base Period (6 months, notional):**

| Milestone | Description                        | Due      |
| --------- | ---------------------------------- | -------- |
| M0        | Kickoff; finalize plans (D-1)      | End Mo 1 |
| M1        | SMART Engine v1 (D-2)              | Mid Mo 3 |
| M2        | RFI/RFP + Posting (D-3)            | End Mo 3 |
| M3        | Market Scan (D-4)                  | End Mo 4 |
| M4        | EZSource Ingest (D-5)              | End Mo 5 |
| M5        | Eval Engine + EN Assist (D-6)      | End Mo 5 |
| M6        | SSA Deck Generator (D-7)           | Mid Mo 6 |
| M7        | Pilot \& Final Demo + Metrics (D-8) | End Mo 6 |
| M8        | Training \& Transition (D-9)       | End Mo 6 |

Options per CLIN table.

---

## Section G - Contract Administration

- **Invoicing:** WAWF iRAPT monthly, tied to accepted deliverables.
- **COR:** \[Name], email, phone.
- **Kickoff \& IPT Cadence:** Weekly stand-ups; monthly IPRs.

---

## Section H - Special Contract Requirements

### H.1 Intellectual Property \& Data Rights

- Custom code, configs, and model **fine-tunes** developed under this contract: **Government Purpose Rights** (or better, as negotiated).
- Pre-existing tools/models: retain contractor rights; provide licenses sufficient for Government use.
- Training data derived from Government artifacts remains a **Government data asset**; provide export of derived features and annotations.

### H.2 AI Transparency \& Safety

- Provide **model cards**, training data lineage, evaluation reports, drift monitoring plan.
- Enable **explainability** for key scoring decisions; retain **full audit trails**.
- HITL required for all source selection-sensitive outputs; tool must log rationale and approvals.

### H.3 Security \& Hosting

- Conform to Section C R8. If external AI APIs are proposed, describe boundary protections, redaction, encryption, and data residency; default to Gov-hosted execution where feasible.

### H.4 Organizational Conflicts of Interest (OCI)

- Offerors shall disclose any real or potential OCI related to source selection support. The solution must segregate personnel and data as required; the Government may impose firewalls or exclusions from future procurements.

### H.5 Section 508

- Accessibility conformance report (VPAT) required.

---

## Section I - Contract Clauses

\[Insert FAR/DFARS clauses appropriate to contract type, data rights, cybersecurity (e.g., DFARS 252.204-7012, 252.204-7019/7020/7021), 52.204-21, 52.204-23, 52.204-25, etc., per Contracting Office.]

---

## Section J - Attachments

- **J-1:** F-47 Maintenance ERP - Email Threads (Initial, Downtime, SMART)
- **J-2:** F-47 AI Log \& Supply ERP - Email Threads (Kickoff, Deeper, Partial SMART, Fully SMART)
- **J-3:** EZSource API Specs \[TBD]
- **J-4:** Data Classification \& Redaction Rules \[TBD]
- **J-5:** SSA Deck Template \[TBD]

---

## Section K - Reps \& Certs

SAM.gov active registration required; submit completed representations and certifications or certify via SAM.

---

## Section L - Instructions to Offerors

### L.1 Submission Format

- **Volumes \& Limits** (page limits exclude resumes, SBOMs, and attachments):

  - **Vol I - Executive \& Management (10 pages)**: Understanding, approach, schedule, risks/mitigations.
  - **Vol II - Technical (35 pages)**: Architecture, data/model plan, APIs, EZSource integration, security, usability, performance, Section C metrics compliance.
  - **Vol III - Pilot Demonstration Plan (15 pages)**: How you will meet C.6 tests using J-1/J-2; KPIs; HITL gates.
  - **Vol IV - Staffing \& Past Performance (15 pages)**: Key personnel resumes (2 pages each max), 3 relevant projects within 5 years.
  - **Vol V - Price (no page limit)**: CLINized pricing, BoE, labor mix, licenses, cloud usage estimates, assumptions.
  - **Vol VI - Security \& Compliance (10 pages)**: RMF strategy, FedRAMP/IL path, CMMC/NIST 800-171 posture, SBOM \& SCRM.
  - **Vol VII - IP \& Data Rights (5 pages)**: Assertions, licenses, Government usage, model weights/artifact rights.

- **Format:** PDF, 8.5x11, 11-pt, 1" margins, searchable; filename: `[Offeror]-[RFP#]-[Vol]-vX.pdf`.

- **Submission:** Via \[portal/email], due **\[MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT]**. Questions due **\[MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT]**.

### L.2 Required Plans/Artifacts

- System Architecture diagram(s); API specs; Data Management \& Governance Plan; Security Plan; TEMP; Risk Register; SBOM (initial, updated each release).
- Pilot Demo scripts and success measures aligned to Section C.6.
- EZSource integration approach and test harness.
- Model transparency package (model cards, evaluation datasets description, bias checks).

### L.3 Assumptions \& Constraints

- Identify all third-party services/models; provide licensing terms and data handling.
- Identify any data that must leave Government boundary and the mitigations; propose on-prem alternatives.

### L.4 Orals/Demo (If Invited)

- 90-minute live demo of end-to-end flow using a Government-provided messy requirement (revealed 48 hours prior).
- Q&A with technical SMEs and contracting.

---

## Section M - Evaluation Factors for Award

**Best-Value Tradeoff.** The Government intends to award to the offeror whose proposal is most advantageous, considering the following factors (listed in descending order of importance unless stated otherwise):

1. **Technical/Management Approach** (Significantly more important than Price)
   - Soundness and completeness vs. Section C requirements; feasibility of schedule; quality of TEMP.
   - SMART engine quality approach, explainability, HITL design.
   - EZSource integration maturity; market scan evidence model; SSA deck automation.

2. **Pilot Demonstration Plan \& Past Performance**
   - Realism and rigor of C.6 test approach; understanding of risks/mitigations.
   - Relevance and success on similar Government/enterprise automation efforts.

3. **Security \& Compliance**
   - RMF strategy, FedRAMP/IL path, CMMC posture, SBOM/SCRM.
   - Data governance and IP rights clarity.

4. **Price**
   - Reasonableness and realism of CLINized pricing and labor mix.

> **Note:** Non-price factors, when combined, are **significantly more important than price**. The Government may make award without discussions; offerors are urged to submit their best terms initially.

---

## Glossary

- **ACE** - Acquisition Center of Excellence (Gov't SMEs)
- **EZSource** - Government proposal repository/selection system
- **EN** - Evaluation Notice
- **HITL** - Human-in-the-Loop
- **RMF** - Risk Management Framework
- **SSA** - Source Selection Authority (briefing/deck)

---

### Quick-Start Checklist (For the CO to Tailor)

- [ ] Insert RFP number, NAICS, set-aside, and POP
- [ ] Confirm contract type and clause set
- [ ] Finalize J-3...J-5 attachments
- [ ] Validate metrics and acceptance thresholds
- [ ] Publish Q&A timeline and submission portal
- [ ] Coordinate OCI language with legal

Request for Proposals (RFP)

AI Acquisition Automation Program Solicitation No.: [TBD] Issue Date: [TBD] Response Due: [MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT] Point of Contact (POC): [Name], Contracting Officer, [email@domain.mil] Secondary POC: [Name], Contract Specialist, [email@domain.mil]

Disclaimer (Example Template): This is a notional RFP template prepared for internal planning and training. Replace bracketed items and verify clause selections with your contracting office.

Section A - Overview

The U.S. Air Force seeks proposals for an AI-enabled acquisition automation prototype that reduces cycle time and workload across the requirements-to-award pipeline. The prototype shall convert messy requirements into SMART requirements, automate RFI/RFP drafting and posting, scan the vendor market, collect proposals into EZSource, support automated source selection evaluations with human-in-the-loop (HITL) review, and generate an SSA briefing deck to justify award decisions.

The Government anticipates a phased, competitive down-select culminating in a single award. The Government will furnish SME access (ACE/EZSource) and entry-level TEAMS training for Government stakeholders.

Section B - Supplies/Services and Prices

Contract Type: [Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP) Base with Optional CLINs; include T\&M/FFP-LOE only if justified]

CLIN Description Deliverables (summary) POP Price
0001 Architecture \& Prototype Plan System Architecture, Data Mgmt Plan, Security Plan, Test \& Evaluation Master Plan (TEMP) Base Mo 1 $_____
0002 SMART Requirements Engine (v1) Requirement extraction/transformation service; metrics dashboard Base Mo 2-3 $_____
0003 RFI/RFP Drafting \& Posting Automation RFI/RFP builder, posting adapter for ad hoc FEDBIZ/SAM-style portal Base Mo 2-4 $_____
0004 Vendor Market Scan Service Market scan pipelines, vendor ranking, auditable scoring Base Mo 3-4 $_____
0005 Proposal Ingest to EZSource Adapters/APIs, schema maps, error handling, audit logs Base Mo 3-5 $_____
0006 Eval Engine \& SSA Deck Generator Criteria config, rubric execution, EN drafting assist, SSA deck builder Base Mo 4-6 $_____
0007 Pilot \& Demo (F-47 corpus) End-to-end pilot using provided email threads \& artifacts Base Mo 6 $_____
0008 Training \& Transition User guides, CBT/TEAMS modules, operator \& admin training Base Mo 6 $_____
0009 (OPT) Hardening \& Scale-out Perf/security hardening, IL[4/5] deployment path OY1 $_____
0010 (OPT) O\&M / Help Desk Patches, updates, SLAs OY1 $_____
0011 (OPT) Data/Model Governance Model re-training, drift monitoring, SBOM updates OY1 $_____

Note: Offerors shall provide a detailed price breakout by labor category, hours, ODCs, cloud usage, and any third-party licenses per CLIN.

Section C - Description/Specifications/Statement of Work (SOW)

C.1 Background \& Purpose

The Air Force is launching a high-impact initiative to revolutionize how it builds requirements, posts RFIs/RFPs, evaluates proposals, and awards contracts. The solution will automate around core programs to reduce cycle time, confusion, and manual workload-not replace them.

C.2 Concept of Operations (CONOPS) - In Scope

  1. SMART Requirement Analysis \& Refinement
  2. Ingest unstructured inputs (emails, notes) and produce SMART requirements with traceability to sources.

  3. Provide confidence scores, explainability, and human accept/reject workflow.

  4. Automated RFI/RFP Drafting \& Posting

  5. Generate draft RFIs/RFPs from approved SMART requirements and acquisition strategy templates.

  6. Post via adapter to an ad hoc FEDBIZ-style site (and/or SAM-compatible export), with version control and audit.

  7. Vendor Market Scanning

  8. Scan public data sources to identify qualified vendors, rank against requirements, and capture evidence trails.

  9. Proposal Collection \& Upload to EZSource

  10. Validate submissions, normalize metadata, and bulk upload to EZSource with error handling and audit logs.

  11. Automated Evaluation \& EN Drafting

  12. Execute configurable rubrics; draft Evaluation Notices (ENs); support consensus documentation; maintain full provenance.

  13. SSA Briefing Deck Generation

  14. Auto-compile SSA deck materials to support best-value decisions and trade-off narratives (HITL approval required).

C.3 Notional Operating Roles

  • Team 1 - Source Selection Team (Gov't): Defines evaluation criteria, operates tools, approves outputs.
  • Contractor(s): Build website/adapters, market scan automations, proposal ingest, eval engines, SSA deck generator.
  • ACE \& EZSource Teams (Gov't): Provide SME support and TEAMS training to Government users.

C.4 Government-Furnished Information (GFI) \& Attachments

  • Attachment J-1: F-47 Requirement Email Threads (Initial Discussion; Downtime Reduction; SMART Refinement) - for ingestion, SMART transformation, and traceability demonstrations.
  • Attachment J-2: F-47 AI-Powered Log \& Supply ERP Threads (Kickoff; Digging Deeper; Partial SMART; Fully SMART) - for additional scenario runs and benchmarking.
  • Attachment J-3: EZSource API/adapter specifications [TBD].
  • Attachment J-4: Data classification guide and redaction rules [TBD].

C.5 Technical Requirements (Minimum)

  • R1 - SMART Engine Quality: >= 0.85 F1 on test set for correct extraction of Specific/Measurable/Time-bound elements; >= 95% source-trace coverage.
  • R2 - Posting Automation: Generate RFI/RFP drafts that pass contracting officer checklist with <= 10% manual edits on average for pilot artifacts.
  • R3 - Market Scan: Identify >= 90% of known qualified vendors in a Government-curated truth set; provide explainable ranking features.
  • R4 - EZSource Ingest: 100% schema compliance; <= 0.5% reject rate due to format errors in pilot.
  • R5 - Evaluation Engine: Execute rubric scoring with inter-rater reliability >= 0.8 vs. human panel baseline; produce draft ENs aligned to criteria.
  • R6 - SSA Deck: Auto-compile a complete draft deck covering factors, ratings, risks, and trade-off rationale conforming to Gov template.
  • R7 - HITL Controls: Every automation has human approval gates; all actions fully auditable (who/what/when/source).
  • R8 - Security \& Compliance:
  • Data protection consistent with RMF (DoDI 8510.01) objectives and NIST SP 800-53 Moderate controls for pilot;
  • If cloud services are used, align to FedRAMP Moderate and DoD Cloud SRG IL4/5 path (as applicable);
  • NIST SP 800-171/CMMC L2 for contractor systems handling CUI;
  • SBOM for deliverables; supply-chain risk management; zero-trust principles;
  • No training on non-public Government data without written consent; redact per J-4.
  • R9 - Accessibility \& Usability: Section 508 conformance; role-based access; audit logs; admin dashboards.
  • R10 - Interoperability: Open APIs; export/import of artifacts (JSON/CSV/PDF/DOCX); containerized deployment option.

C.6 Acceptance Criteria (Pilot)

Using Attachments J-1 and J-2:

  1. SMART Transformation Test: Produce SMART requirements and a comparison report showing trace links back to specific emails. Pass if >=0.85 F1 and >=95% trace coverage (R1).
  2. End-to-End Run: Given a sample messy requirement, generate an RFI and RFP draft, perform market scan (top-10 ranked list with evidence), simulate proposal ingest (mock files), run evaluation rubric, draft ENs, and produce an SSA deck. Pass if all artifacts meet R2-R6 thresholds and logs are complete.
  3. Security \& Audit: Demonstrate role-based HITL approvals and immutable audit logs; pass RMF control checks for the pilot scope.

C.7 Deliverables (Data Rights in Section H)

  • D-1 Architecture \& Data Mgmt Plan; Security Plan; TEMP
  • D-2 SMART Engine (container/image), config, and APIs
  • D-3 RFI/RFP Generator + Posting Adapter
  • D-4 Market Scan Pipelines + Evidence Store
  • D-5 EZSource Ingest Adapters
  • D-6 Evaluation Engine + EN Drafting Assist
  • D-7 SSA Deck Generator + Gov Template
  • D-8 Pilot Demo Report \& Metrics Pack
  • D-9 Training Materials (CBT, TEAMS decks), Admin \& User Guides

Section D - Packaging \& Marking

Electronic deliverables via secure repository ([TBD]), with checksum and SBOM. Mark CUI per J-4.

Section E - Inspection \& Acceptance

  • Government COR reviews deliverables against Section C metrics within 10 business days.
  • Defects tracked to closure; re-test permitted within POP.

Section F - Deliveries or Performance (Schedule)

Base Period (6 months, notional):

Milestone Description Due
M0 Kickoff; finalize plans (D-1) End Mo 1
M1 SMART Engine v1 (D-2) Mid Mo 3
M2 RFI/RFP + Posting (D-3) End Mo 3
M3 Market Scan (D-4) End Mo 4
M4 EZSource Ingest (D-5) End Mo 5
M5 Eval Engine + EN Assist (D-6) End Mo 5
M6 SSA Deck Generator (D-7) Mid Mo 6
M7 Pilot \& Final Demo + Metrics (D-8) End Mo 6
M8 Training \& Transition (D-9) End Mo 6

Options per CLIN table.

Section G - Contract Administration

  • Invoicing: WAWF iRAPT monthly, tied to accepted deliverables.
  • COR: [Name], email, phone.
  • Kickoff \& IPT Cadence: Weekly stand-ups; monthly IPRs.

Section H - Special Contract Requirements

H.1 Intellectual Property \& Data Rights

  • Custom code, configs, and model fine-tunes developed under this contract: Government Purpose Rights (or better, as negotiated).
  • Pre-existing tools/models: retain contractor rights; provide licenses sufficient for Government use.
  • Training data derived from Government artifacts remains a Government data asset; provide export of derived features and annotations.

H.5 Section 508

Section I - Contract Clauses

[Insert FAR/DFARS clauses appropriate to contract type, data rights, cybersecurity (e.g., DFARS 252.204-7012, 252.204-7019/7020/7021), 52.204-21, 52.204-23, 52.204-25, etc., per Contracting Office.]

Section J - Attachments

  • J-1: F-47 Maintenance ERP - Email Threads (Initial, Downtime, SMART)
  • J-2: F-47 AI Log \& Supply ERP - Email Threads (Kickoff, Deeper, Partial SMART, Fully SMART)
  • J-3: EZSource API Specs [TBD]
  • J-4: Data Classification \& Redaction Rules [TBD]
  • J-5: SSA Deck Template [TBD]

Section K - Reps \& Certs

SAM.gov active registration required; submit completed representations and certifications or certify via SAM.

Section L - Instructions to Offerors

L.1 Submission Format

  • Volumes \& Limits (page limits exclude resumes, SBOMs, and attachments):

  • Vol I - Executive \& Management (10 pages): Understanding, approach, schedule, risks/mitigations.

  • Vol II - Technical (35 pages): Architecture, data/model plan, APIs, EZSource integration, security, usability, performance, Section C metrics compliance.
  • Vol III - Pilot Demonstration Plan (15 pages): How you will meet C.6 tests using J-1/J-2; KPIs; HITL gates.
  • Vol IV - Staffing \& Past Performance (15 pages): Key personnel resumes (2 pages each max), 3 relevant projects within 5 years.
  • Vol V - Price (no page limit): CLINized pricing, BoE, labor mix, licenses, cloud usage estimates, assumptions.
  • Vol VI - Security \& Compliance (10 pages): RMF strategy, FedRAMP/IL path, CMMC/NIST 800-171 posture, SBOM \& SCRM.

  • Vol VII - IP \& Data Rights (5 pages): Assertions, licenses, Government usage, model weights/artifact rights.

  • Format: PDF, 8.5x11, 11-pt, 1" margins, searchable; filename: [Offeror]-[RFP#]-[Vol]-vX.pdf.

  • Submission: Via [portal/email], due [MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT]. Questions due [MM/DD/YYYY HHMM CT].

L.2 Required Plans/Artifacts

  • System Architecture diagram(s); API specs; Data Management \& Governance Plan; Security Plan; TEMP; Risk Register; SBOM (initial, updated each release).
  • Pilot Demo scripts and success measures aligned to Section C.6.
  • EZSource integration approach and test harness.
  • Model transparency package (model cards, evaluation datasets description, bias checks).

L.3 Assumptions \& Constraints

  • Identify all third-party services/models; provide licensing terms and data handling.
  • Identify any data that must leave Government boundary and the mitigations; propose on-prem alternatives.

L.4 Orals/Demo (If Invited)

  • 90-minute live demo of end-to-end flow using a Government-provided messy requirement (revealed 48 hours prior).
  • Q&A with technical SMEs and contracting.

Section M - Evaluation Factors for Award

Best-Value Tradeoff. The Government intends to award to the offeror whose proposal is most advantageous, considering the following factors (listed in descending order of importance unless stated otherwise):

  1. Technical/Management Approach (Significantly more important than Price)
  2. Soundness and completeness vs. Section C requirements; feasibility of schedule; quality of TEMP.
  3. SMART engine quality approach, explainability, HITL design.

  4. EZSource integration maturity; market scan evidence model; SSA deck automation.

  5. Pilot Demonstration Plan \& Past Performance

  6. Realism and rigor of C.6 test approach; understanding of risks/mitigations.

  7. Relevance and success on similar Government/enterprise automation efforts.

  8. Security \& Compliance

  9. RMF strategy, FedRAMP/IL path, CMMC posture, SBOM/SCRM.

  10. Data governance and IP rights clarity.

  11. Price

  12. Reasonableness and realism of CLINized pricing and labor mix.

Note: Non-price factors, when combined, are significantly more important than price. The Government may make award without discussions; offerors are urged to submit their best terms initially.

Glossary

  • ACE - Acquisition Center of Excellence (Gov't SMEs)
  • EZSource - Government proposal repository/selection system
  • EN - Evaluation Notice
  • HITL - Human-in-the-Loop
  • RMF - Risk Management Framework
  • SSA - Source Selection Authority (briefing/deck)

Quick-Start Checklist (For the CO to Tailor)

  • [ ] Insert RFP number, NAICS, set-aside, and POP
  • [ ] Confirm contract type and clause set
  • [ ] Finalize J-3...J-5 attachments
  • [ ] Validate metrics and acceptance thresholds
  • [ ] Publish Q&A timeline and submission portal
  • [ ] Coordinate OCI language with legal
